page.title: 19LONGSTANTON FEAST
page.content: A long-standing village tradition is Feast Week, held, since Victorian times at least, during the third week in June. The custom died out for a time but was revived six years ago; since then Feast Week has been organised by the Sports and Social Club. Preparations begin six months ahead and fifteen or twenty people are involved. Events include various sporting activities and competitions, and a fete on the Saturday afternoon. Profits are shared equally between the Sports and Social Club and the groups promoting individual events. The Sports and Social Club currently uses this income to pay off the loan raised for their Pavilion. The maximum profit in the last six years has been Â£900; this year the profit was Â£600.
